body:
@mdempsky That's a nice suggestion and I see @griesemer has already implemented it. Thanks to both of you.

A side note: What tripped me in the understanding of this particular part of specs is this

> Constant expressions are always evaluated exactly; ...

I just stopped reading after the word *exactly*, as I automatically, but wrongly, assumed it naturaly implies arithmetic commutativity/associativity is granted for the *whole expression* - as is the case with *exact*/symbolic arithmetics, like seen in Maxima or Mathematica or any other CAS.

I learned that actually the specified exactness works granularly - for every [binary] operation in particular, but then the intermediate result is possibly turned *inexact* by applying a specific domain, eg. â„¤ - with the loss of arithmetic commutativity and/or associativity.

I can see the reason for this difference wrt to "ideal" const expression evaluation and I'm fine with it.

Thanks again to all for the explanation.
